page.title: 03 THE LEIGH
page.content: The Leigh was mentioned in the first Domesday Book as LALEGE, one hide in extent, belonging to the Priory of Deerhurst, 4 kilometres to the north. The first mention of the church was in 1125, the oldest part remaining being a side chapel in the Early English style. The church was originally called St James but changed its name at some time to St Catherines. The Leigh is a very small quiet village although it is only a kilometre from the A.38 main road. The manor house called Leigh Court together with the church are separated by several fields from the rest of the village. There are still remains of a moat there.
